list.expr: sum by (pod, container) (changes(kube_pod_container_status_restarts_total{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod", container=~"$container"}[$__interval])) > 0
list.name: Container restart

targets.expr:
max by(pod, workload_type, workload, uid, node, container, name) (
  last_over_time(container_last_seen_time{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container="$container", name=~"$id", uid!=""}[$__range])
) * 1000 * on(pod, uid) group_left(workload_type, workload)
max by(pod, workload_type, workload, uid) (
  last_over_time(namespace_workload_pod:kube_pod_owner:relabel{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid!="", workload_type!="static-pod"}[$__range])
)
# using a single query with "OR" here because otherwise grafana would show 2 separate "Last seen" columns
or
max by(pod, workload_type, workload, uid, node, container, name) (
  last_over_time(container_last_seen_time{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", container="$container", name=~"$id", uid!=""}[$__range])
) * 1000 * on(pod) group_left(workload_type, workload)
# omitting uid here because for static pods cadvisor uid does not match kube-state-metrics uid
max by(pod, workload_type, workload) (
  last_over_time(namespace_workload_pod:kube_pod_owner:relabel{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", uid!="", workload_type="static-pod"}[$__range])
)

last_over_time(kube_pod_container_status_last_terminated_timestamp{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod", container=~"$container"}[$__range])
* 1000
last_over_time(kube_pod_container_status_last_terminated_exitcode{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod", container=~"$container"}[$__range])
last_over_time(kube_pod_container_status_last_terminated_reason{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod", container=~"$container"}[$__range])
min by(pod) (min_over_time(kube_pod_status_ready{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod", condition="true"}[$__rate_interval]))
min by(container) (min_over_time(kube_pod_container_status_ready{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod"}[$__rate_interval]))
sum by (pod, container) (max_over_time(kube_pod_container_status_restarts_total{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod", container=~"$container"}[$__rate_interval]))
sum by(container, name) (rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod", container=~"$container", name=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval]))
sum (rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod", container=~"$container", name=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval]))

# if container didn't run at some interval, you will have division by zero, so we do ` / increase + epsilon`
max by (container, name) (
  (increase(container_cpu_cfs_throttled_periods_total{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod", container=~"$container", name=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval]) )
/
  (increase(container_cpu_cfs_periods_total[$__rate_interval]) + 1e-5 )
)

# if container didn't run at some interval, you will have division by zero, so we do ` / increase + epsilon`
max by (container, name) (
  (increase(container_cpu_cgroup_burst_periods_total{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod", container=~"$container", name=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval]) )
/ on(container, name)
  (increase(container_cpu_cfs_periods_total[$__rate_interval]) + 1e-5 )
)
max by (container, name) (last_over_time(container_memory_rss{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod", container=~"$container", name=~"$id"}[$__range]))

# this query returns more results than RSS and WSS
# I guess this is because when containers restart rapidly,
# KSM still remembers them but cadvisor misses them
max by (container, name) (
  last_over_time(
    (
      label_replace(
        kube_pod_container_info{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod", container=~"$container", container_id=~"containerd://($id)"},
        "name", "$1", "container_id", "containerd://(.*)"
      )
      * on(pod, container, uid)
      kube_pod_container_resource_requests{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod", container=~"$container", resource="memory"}
    )
  [$__range:])
)
max by (container, name) (last_over_time(container_memory_working_set_bytes{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod", container=~"$container", name=~"$id"}[$__range]))
max by (container, name) (last_over_time(container_memory_cache{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod", container=~"$container", name=~"$id"}[$__range]))
max by (container, name) (last_over_time(container_memory_swap{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod", container=~"$container", name=~"$id"}[$__range]))
max by (container, name) (last_over_time(container_memory_max_usage_bytes{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod", container=~"$container", name=~"$id"}[$__range]))
max by (container, name) (last_over_time(container_memory_usage_bytes{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod", container=~"$container", name=~"$id"}[$__range]))

options.content:
- `RSS` is memory allocated explicitly
- `RSS` + Active   cache -> `WSS`
- `WSS` + Inactive cache -> `Raw` memory usage
- Formula: Cache = Active + Inactive
- Cache is active if it used _often_ (more than once?)
- RSS and cache are exact values
- `Raw` is kernel approximation used for cache flushing and OOM killer
- `WSS` is roughly `Raw` - Inactive cache

What to look for:
- WSS reaching limit causes file garbage collection
- RSS reaching limit causes OOM kill

panels.description: You are encouraged to select a single container to make this graph easier to read.

targets.expr: max by (container, name) (max_over_time(container_memory_max_usage_bytes{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod", container=~"$container", name=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval]))
max by (container, name) (max_over_time(container_memory_usage_bytes{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod", container=~"$container", name=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval]))
max by (container, name) (max_over_time(container_memory_working_set_bytes{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod", container=~"$container", name=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval]))
max by (container, name) (max_over_time(container_memory_rss{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod", container=~"$container", name=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval]))
max by (container) (kube_pod_container_resource_limits{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod", resource="memory", container=~"$container", invalid=$enableLimits})
max by (container) (kube_pod_container_resource_requests{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod", resource="memory", container=~"$container", invalid=$enableLimits})

max by (container, name)(max_over_time(container_memory_mapped_file{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod", container=~"$container", name=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval]))
sum(rate(container_network_receive_bytes_total{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod"}[$__rate_interval])) by (interface)

sum(rate(container_network_transmit_packets_dropped_total{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod"}[$__rate_interval])) by (interface)

options.content:
Read/write from NFS and SMB shares
will not be shown in the storage throughput.

Cadvisor exports data from cgroup io.stats,
which are only calculated for block devices.

targets.expr: sum by(container) (rate(container_fs_reads_bytes_total{container!="", container=~"$container", cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod"}[$__rate_interval]))
sum by(container) (rate(container_fs_writes_bytes_total{container!="", container=~"$container", cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod"}[$__rate_interval]))
sum by(pod) (ephemeral_storage_pod_usage{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod"})
sum by(pod, volume_name) (ephemeral_storage_container_volume_usage{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod=~"$pod"})

list.definition: query_result(label_join(last_over_time(namespace_workload_pod:kube_pod_owner:relabel{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", workload=~"$workload"}[$__range]) * on(cluster, namespace, pod, uid) group_left() max by(cluster, namespace, pod, uid) (last_over_time(kube_pod_container_status_ready{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace"}[$__range])) * on(cluster, namespace, pod, uid) group_left(node) max by(cluster, namespace, pod, uid, node) (last_over_time(kube_pod_info{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace"}[$__range])), "human_name", "/", "node", "pod"))
list.label: pod
list.name: pod

query.query: query_result(label_join(last_over_time(namespace_workload_pod:kube_pod_owner:relabel{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", workload=~"$workload"}[$__range]) * on(cluster, namespace, pod, uid) group_left() max by(cluster, namespace, pod, uid) (last_over_time(kube_pod_container_status_ready{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace"}[$__range])) * on(cluster, namespace, pod, uid) group_left(node) max by(cluster, namespace, pod, uid, node) (last_over_time(kube_pod_info{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace"}[$__range])), "human_name", "/", "node", "pod"))

list.definition: query_result(label_replace(last_over_time(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod", container=~"$container"}[$__range]),"human_name", "$1","name", "(.*)") # for unknown reason,# when I try to match 'name' for both text and value,# they are the same,# despite regexp being different: '[^"]{8}' and '[^"]+')
list.name: id

query.query: query_result(label_replace(last_over_time(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{cluster="$cluster", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod", container=~"$container"}[$__range]),"human_name", "$1","name", "(.*)") # for unknown reason,# when I try to match 'name' for both text and value,# they are the same,# despite regexp being different: '[^"]{8}' and '[^"]+')
